  • Help

All Classes

Class
Description
AudioManager
The AudioManager class handles the initializing and playing of all types of sound.
Bloon
The Bloon class, representing a balloon and the main enemy of the game.
BloonSender
A class that adds bloons to the game scene based on the wave data text file.
BloonType
The enum for different bloon types (much cleaner than individual bloon classes & inheritance).
BoxBounds
A component to define a box-shaped bound for a gameobject.
Button
An abstract class for defining a clickable box-shaped button game object.
BuyInfo
A container class for defining various parts of an object that is purchaseable, namely the title, description, and base cost (before modifiers).
CircleBounds
A component to define a circle-shaped bound for a gameobject.
Component
An abstract class for defining components of gameobjects that have their own behaviour.
Difficulty
An enum for the difficulty of the game.
Display
A class for creating a JFrame to display the game.
FireRobot
The short range fire robot that spews fire towards bloons.
Flame
The projectile that the fire robot uses.
Game
The main Game class where the game is initialized and played.
GameObject
An abstract class defining a game object - an object that exists and interacts with other game objects inside of a game scene.
GameScene
A scene for the main game of robot tower defense.
GameScene.State
 
IceRobot
The long-range sniper robot that shoots ice at bloons.
InputManager
The InputManager class is used to register key press, mouse movement, and mouse clicks and then store them for use in game.
Launcher
 
Lightning
A projectile that the lightning robot uses.
LightningRobot
The lightning robot that zaps bloons that come into its range.
MainMenuScene
The main menu scene, where various tracks can be loaded and played.
ObjectGroup<T extends GameObject>
A custom list that works for the gamescene.
PauseMenu
The pause menu scene, which allows players to pause the game and change a variety of settings.
Pellet
The basic projectile type.
PhysicsComponent
A component that lets game objects move with their velocity.
Projectile
An abstract class that defines projectiles, which are moving objects that pop bloons.
ProjectileData
A container class used to store the data of a projectile.
RenderComponent
A component that renders the game object, its sprite, and other rendering-related things to the Renderer.
Renderer
A custom "wrapper class" for the Graphics2D object.
Robot
The basic robot that shoots pellets towards bloons.
Scene
An abstract Scene object that allows for different parts of the game, for example the main menu, game area, pause menu, etc.
Scissor
The projectile that the scissor robot uses.
ScissorRobot
A robot that shoots scissor projectiles.
Settings
A container class for holding the settings of the game.
Shop
The object for defining the shop within the game.
Sprite
A class that represents a sprite, an image to be drawn to the screen.
SpriteManager
The class that handles the loading and managing of all game sprites.
Subpanel
A panel for each branch in the tower's upgrade path.
Timer
A class used for timing events in real seconds.
Tip
A button that appears at the bottom of the game scene to provide tips and instructions on how to play the game.
Tower
The abstract class for a tower - a buyable and placeable object that defends against bloons by shooting projectiles.
TowerButton
A button used in the shop to purchase and place towers, and also to display their info and price.
Track
The track object defines the "map" of the game, where bloons enter, exit, and move along, and where towers can be placed.
TrackData
A serializable object that represents the three main parts of a track: background image, mask image, and list of points that the bloons move along.
TrackLoader
A class that loads all of the .track files in resources to be used in game.
TrackSerializer
A custom application for serializing tracks into .track files that can be used in the robot tower defense game.
Upgrade
An abstract class for defining an upgrade to a tower, a buyable object with a cost that, when bought, changes a tower in certain way (usually its projectiledata or other related things).
UpgradePanel
A panel to provide purchaseable upgrades for the selected tower.
UpgradePath
A class for defining the path that a tower progresses when applying multiple upgrades to itself.
UpgradePath.State
The state of a branch/upgrade.
Vector2
A class used to store a pair of coordinates, a 2D vector, or any other miscellaneous pair of numbers.
Wave
A container class for storing waves of bloons for each round.
